alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots are expected or occurring in the area.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots are expected or occurring in the area.

Thunderstorms approaching from Minnesota may be capable of producing wind gusts to 35 knots. These storms are likely producing up to toonie sized hail.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots and frequent lightning are expected or occurring in the area.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots and frequent lightning are expected or occurring in the area.

Thunderstorms approaching from Minnesota are likely producing ping pong ball sized hail.  These storms may also be capable of producing wind gusts to 35 knots.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots and frequent lightning are expected or occurring in the area.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots and frequent lightning are expected or occurring in the area.

Thunderstorms tracking northeast over Lake of the Woods are capable of producing wind gusts to 35 knots and nickel sized hail.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

alerts.headline: rainfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Rain, at times heavy, is expected.

What:
Total rainfall amounts of 50 to 75 mm. Amounts in excess of 75 mm are possible for areas that receive multiple thunderstorms.

When:
This evening through Sunday.

Additional information:
Showers, at times heavy, and thunderstorms are expected to move through northwestern Ontario ahead of a low pressure system. The significant rainfall will move from southwest to northeast, with multiple rounds of heavy showers possible for some areas, before tapering off late Sunday.

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details

###

Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Watch for possible washouts near rivers, creeks and culverts.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots and frequent lightning are expected or occurring in the area.

Thunderstorms tracking east over Lake of the Woods are capable of producing wind gusts to 35 knots and nickel sized hail.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots and frequent lightning are expected or occurring in the area.

Thunderstorms tracking east over Lake of the Woods are capable of producing wind gusts to 35 knots.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

alerts.headline: squall warning ended
alerts.description:
Squalls have weakened or moved out of the area.


###

alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, damaging hail and torrential rain.

Hazards:
Large hail up to 3 cm diameter.
Strong wind gusts up to 90 km/h.
Locally heavy rainfall.

Timing:
Ending this morning.

Discussion:
An unseasonable mild and unstable air mass may continue to allow for the development of severe thunderstorms this morning.  Some of these storms may produce up to toonie sized hail, strong winds and torrential rain. The severe threat is expected to diminish later this morning.

###

Utility outages are possible. Significant damage to property, buildings and trees is possible.

Heavy rain can cause flash flooding and significant reductions to visibility.

Strong wind gusts can damage trees, buildings and overturn vehicles.

Large hail can cause significant damage and injury.

Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms capable of producing damaging hail, wind or rain.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

For more information: https://www.ontario.ca/page/be-prepared-emergency.
alerts.instruction:
When thunder roars, go indoors! Lightning kills and injures Canadians every year. Don't drive through flooded roadways.

Emergency Management Ontario recommends that you take cover immediately if threatening weather approaches.

alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Strong winds possible.

What:
Strong winds with gusts of 70 to 90 km/h possible. 

When: 
This afternoon into this evening.

Additional Information: 
Strong winds are expected to develop this afternoon as a strong low pressure system and associated cold front pushes through northwestern Ontario. The winds will ease from southwest to northeast through this evening. 

Wind warnings may be needed for some areas as the event approaches. Thunderstorms may impact the area through this afternoon as well. Any thunderstorms that develop may generate local wind gusts in excess of 90 km/h.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

affected_areas.area_description: Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake

alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Strong winds possible tonight.

What:
Strong winds with gusts of 70 to 90 km/h possible. 

When: 
Tonight into early Monday morning.

Additional Information: 
Strong southwesterly winds are expected to develop tonight as a strong low pressure system and associated cold front pushes through northern Ontario. The winds will ease from southwest to northeast early Monday morning. 

Wind warnings may be needed for some areas as the event approaches.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts.

Hazards:
Strong wind gusts up to 100 km/h possible.

Timing:
This afternoon.

Discussion:
An unseasonable mild and unstable air mass will allow for the development of severe thunderstorms this afternoon.  Any thunderstorms that develop may produce strong wind gusts up to 100 km/h.

###

Utility outages are possible. Significant damage to property, buildings and trees is possible.

Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms capable of producing damaging hail, wind or rain.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

For more information: https://www.ontario.ca/page/be-prepared-emergency.

When thunder roars, go indoors! Lightning kills and injures Canadians every year.

Emergency Management Ontario recommends that you take cover immediately if threatening weather approaches.

affected_areas.area_description: Ear Falls - Perrault Falls - Western Lac Seul

alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts.

Hazards:
Strong wind gusts up to 100 km/h possible.
Risk of tornadoes.

Timing:
This afternoon into this evening.

Discussion:
An unseasonable mild and unstable air mass will allow for the development of severe thunderstorms this afternoon.  Any thunderstorms that develop may produce strong wind gusts up to 100 km/h. Some storms may have the potential to produce tornadoes, but confidence in the tornado threat is low.

###

Utility outages are possible. Significant damage to property, buildings and trees is possible.

Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms capable of producing damaging hail, wind or rain.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

For more information: https://www.ontario.ca/page/be-prepared-emergency.
